title: K64F serial_format with ParityEven causes assertion error
body:
ParityEven is not handled and results in an assertion error.  One-line fix in attached patch.
[k64f-even-parity.patch.txt](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/files/326414/k64f-even-parity.patch.txt)

title: Targets should have a field to indicate stable version of daplink
body:
Targets should have a field to indicate stable version of daplink, for example `daplink_version` available here:
https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/master/hal/targets.json

This would help mbedls tools to display a warning and ask the user to update the firmware (see request here https://github.com/ARMmbed/greentea/issues/148)

title: [TARGET_STM32F3]: Update Hal 1.5.0
body:
update STM32F3 HAL : 
on IAR, ARM : only MBED_39 is failed
on GCC_ARM : MBED_39 and all rtos due to MBED_RTOS_SINGLE_THREAD definiton in gcc.py

title: Generalize flag handling
body:
affects all flags in:
- memap.py
- build.py
- detect_targets.py
- get_config.py
- make.py
- test.py

All flags that accept a member of list of things now validate that the argument passed is in the list after converting the argument to the appropriate case and replacing "-" with "_" or vice versa, whichever is correct.

All flags that accept file paths (except for build directories) now validate that the file or directory exists.

for example:

``` bash
$ python tools/build.py --source foo
[WARNING] Using default settings. Define your settings in the file "./mbed_settings.py"
usage: build.py [-h] [-m MCU] [-t TOOLCHAIN] [-c] [-o OPTIONS]
                [--source SOURCE_DIR] [--build BUILD_DIR] [--no-archive] [-r]
                [--rpc] [-e] [-U] [-u] [-d] [-F] [-b] [--cpputest] [-D MACROS]
                [-S] [-f GENERAL_FILTER_REGEX] [--cppcheck] [-j JOBS]
                [-N ARTIFACT_NAME] [-v] [--silent] [-x]
build.py: error: argument --source: foo does not exist in the filesystem.
```

and
`python tools/build.py -t gcc-arm -m k64f` is the same as `python tools/build.py -t GCC_ARM -m K64F` is the same as `python tools/bulid.py -t GcC-ArM -m K64f`

title: [Exporters] Update exporters to include and use mbed_conf.h (Was #1964)
body:
Affected exporters:
- gcc_arm
- uVision4
- IAR
- emblocks
- atmelstudio
- codered
- simplicityv3

Summary of discussion:

@0xc0170:
We should wait until the name of mbed_conf.h is set in stone.

@bogdanm:
We should introduce a configuration variable for all exporters to indicate if they export the mbed_conf.h. This will help eliminate duplication.

title: cfstore flash-journal integration with config_system (Resubmitted)
body:
Changes so the flash mode can be selected with config system property.

This was previously submitted in this PR:

https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/1972

But was changed to remove inadvertent device_has LOWPOWERTIMER losses.

@ohagendorf

Please see this new PR.

title: cfstore flash-journal integration with config_system
body:
Changes so the flash mode can be selected with config system property.

Update to this PR after rebase so that LOWPOWERTIMER changes not included.:

https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/1972

title: cfstore flash-journal integration with config_system
body: Changes so the flash mode can be selected with config system property.

title: Config bool to int
body:
Boolean configuration parameters will now be generated as integers (1
for True, 0 for False).

title: Configure stdio baud rate
Rename mbed_conf.h to mbed_config.h
body: Following the pattern of "device_has" to "DEVICE_", "features" to "FEATURE_", the mbed config system should map to mbed_config.h

title: Fixed double-ignored files that cause python exception
body: Also simplify build scanning logic and add comments

title: Checking if ignored dir is in the dir list before removing
body:
This addresses an issue regarding ignored directories. When traversing the source tree, the `.mbedignore` files dictate which directories should be "removed" from the traversal list. If this directory hasn't been added to this list before attempting to remove it, an Exception occurs and a traceback is printed to the user.

This PR adds checks before removing dirs from the traversal list in the cases where the added directories are not being looped over exclusively.

here re-introduced.

Fixes:

title: Fixed exporters to support features
body: Unified how resources are loaded into the configuration system (Config.load_resources) and applied to bith build_api and exporters

title: Fix for libraries being built with features support
Configuration in header files - step 1
body:
The current implementation of the configuration system "compiles" the
configuration parameters to macros defined on the command line. This
works, but has a few limitations:
- it can bring back the maximum command line length issues in Windows.
- depending on the type of the configuration parameter, it might require
  special quoting of its value in the command line.
- various 3rd party IDE/tools seem to have some limitations regarding
  the total length of the macros that can be defined.

This PR is the first step in replacing the current mechanism with
one that generates configuration in header files that will be
automatically included, instead of command line macro definitions.After
this PR is accepted, compiling from the command line will use these
generated header files. Exporters still use the previous mechanism
(a list of macros for the configuration parameters).

The commit also fixes an issue in tools/get_config.py that appeared as a
result of a recent PR: the signature of "get_config" in
tools/build_api.py changed, but tools/get_config.py was not updated.

title: Fixed features not being included
body: Also improve compile speed by not re-scanning the source locations

title: Add -N/--artifact-name argument to parser to name libraries
body: Only makes sence for --source builds (which only work with --build)

title: Export - project name fix (.zip)
body:
Previously it was .zip always, even when using sources. This patch fixes it:`

```
Successful exports:
  * K64F::uvision       path\projectfiles\uvision\Unnamed_Project_K64F
```

@sg- @screamerbg

title: uARM fail with compiled rtos lib
body:
The RTOS tests are failing on at least the NUCLEO_L476RG (uARM only).

```
Looking for NUCLEO_L476RG with MBEDLS
...port ready!
HOST: Reset target...
HOST: Property 'timeout' = '20'
HOST: Property 'host_test_name' = 'default_auto'
HOST: Property 'description' = 'Queue messaging'
HOST: Property 'test_id' = 'RTOS_5'
HOST: Start test...
OS ran out of threads!
```

I have launched some tests before the changes in the compilation flags and they were ok.

I tried to export a test to uvision and I had the same error with the compiled version of the rtos lib (such as rtos.ar and rtx.ar). But if i use the .c files and I compile the rtos lib inside the uvision project, the example works well.

title: [NUCLEO_F746ZG] add IPV4 support for F7 in mbed
body: This modification is to allow IPV4 feature on mbed

title: NUCLEO_F746ZG Ethernet enabling
body:
Hello, 
We should be able to use LwIP library for NUCLEO_F746ZG after this PR.
Cheers
Armelle

title: [Cortex_M7] fpu with single/double precision - bugfix and extension
body:
This is an continuative work of PR #1909 and is a suggestion to discuss the problem of two different Cortex M7 variants: with single or with double precision fpu. Please have a look at the last commit. The other commits are from #1909.
- creating new core name Cortex_M7F_DP for a target with a double precision fpu
- adding new core name to arm.py to set compiler/linker flags to a double precision fpu when configured in target.json; curent state: every Cortex_M7F is configured with single precision fpu
- up to now: gcc wrote flag for a double precision fpu -> target with STM32F746 didn't run when using double variables - mcu has only single precision fpu
- changing gcc.py to use single precision for Cortex-M7F und double precision for Cortex_M7F_DP

tested with NUCLEO_F746, NUCLEO_F767 and build.py+make.py and exporting with project.py + compiling/flashing
- iar.py needs a similar extention - I didn't change that yet because
  - did not run at the moment - python exception
  - currently worked on in PR #1948

title: Update main.cpp
body: Make sure printf gets '\n'

title: iar - fix flags for cmd and exporters
body:
Exporters and cmd do not share all flags, some asm and c flags are not the same (cpu, fpu). 
This is the clean up of the latest changes, that made some changes not available for cmd or exporters.

The changeset applied to mbed lib:

After the change:

C file

```
before:
```

@sg- @bridadan @screamerbg

title: .mbedignore does not recognise some paths correctly
body:
`./mbed-os/` is not recognised, you have to use `mbed-os/`
`*/TESTS/*` does not filter `./TESTS/*` you have to use `TESTS/*`

title: Added feature list for K64F
body:
Without this fix, some required FEATURE_ directories are not included,
which breaks compilation for existing code.

title: STM32Cube_FW_F0_V1.6.0
body:
STM32F0 CMSIS v2.2.3 => v2.3.0
STM32F0 HAL v1.3.1 => v1.4.0

Common tests done for:
- ARM, uARM, GCC and IAR
- NUCLEO_F030R8, NUCLEO_F031K6, NUCLEO_F042K6, NUCLEO_F070RB, NUCLEO_F072RB, NUCLEO_F091RC

=> Same status, no regression

title: Fixes the python traceback when the user does ctrl+c during compilation
Removed IAR --vla flag which breaks compatibility with IAR Workbench
Revert "Fix iar exporter - flags duplication and consolidations"
body:
Reverts mbedmicro/mbed#1938

This breaks all command line builds for IAR. Do not merge patches that are not tested across all toolchains.

title: Update progen to v0.9.x
[build tools] Added better support for features and recursive configs
body:
1. Features now recursively add to cumulative config
2. Added verification of features, error on conflicting feature declarations

supported options:

``` json
{
    "feature": ["CLIENT"],
    "features_add": ["IPV4"],
    "features_remove": ["IPV6"]
}
```

cc @screamerbg @sg-

title: Incorrect inclusion due to header file name clash
body:
`./mbed-os/core/hal/api/critical.h` clash with an header file in an external module `https://github.com/ARMmbed/atomic-queue/blob/master/source/critical.h`. 

`./mbed-os/core/hal/common/Ticker.cpp` includes the wrong file without warning. Fail to find symbols.

This is a common scenario and there should be a strategy in place in mbed tools to avoid these situation from happening.

title: Fix iar exporter - flags duplication and consolidations
body:
We need to distinguish between cmd flags and exporters flags, they are not the same.

cc @theotherjimmy

title: Fixing test builds for devices with softdevices.
body:
Previously, .hex files were not copied when building source as a library.
This prevents builds that pre-compile source as a library and then includes the build directory as the only source (because there is no softdevice present). This PR adds an option to copy hex files when compiling source as a library. This is currently being used when compiling tests within `test.py`

Please review @0xc0170 and @screamerbg 
FYI @pan-

title: Enabled uVisor secure mode for K64F
body:
- new uVisor binary release
- update register-level access gateway code
- K64F example usage for K64F
- __disable_irq conditionally disabled for uVisor-enabled mode

@sg- @0xc0170 @AlessandroA @Patater @niklas-arm

title: [uviosn5] some fixes for PR #1933
body:
- one missing import
- typo: uvision instead of uvision5 used

title: armcc - fix libpath - windows spaces
body: In case libpath is with spaces, in my case it happened :)

title: uvision - remove --cpp flag from exporters
body:
The cpp files are by default compiled with --cpp. Including this flag, causing
C files compiled as C++ files. Thus we remove them. We could potentionally
remove it from cxx flags as well.

This was added just recently as flags unification. It's tricky to unify command line and IDE, as via cmd you can invoke separately asm/c/cxx, but in many IDE c/cxx are within the same tab. Therefore there are some limitations and we need to currently do exceptions for IDE, as in this PR. 

Fixes #1919 

@ohagendorf

title: Removed duplicate feature declarations
body: cc @screamerbg @sg-

title: print generally line feeds for every error prints
body:
this safe a bit memory because we doesn't need to print line feeds for every `error(x)` -calls.
This also standardize that every error prints has proper line-feeds (CR+LF) which is needed by automation.

small side-effect: if `error()`is called with line feed(s) it prints now line feeds twice, but perhaps that is not the problem.

There is list of `error()` prints what we have currently:
https://gist.github.com/jupe/df248c195ecc4f484f06b61e9e8b12d3
NOTE: some of those doesn't have line feeds at all!

@geky @bridadan @0xc0170 @kjbracey-arm

title: Removing K64F_UVISOR target
body: uVisor is now enabled by features, not through targets. Removing the old K64F_UVISOR target.

title: Tools Updates (Tests and build logs)
body:
This improves the following aspects about building and listing tests:
- Build logs has reduced amount of repeated toolchain errors (most, if not all, should be gone now)
- Printing tests is now done in alphabetical order
- Test names are now always printed in lower case
- Test build filtering is now case insensitive and can accept a comma separated list of blob names (as parsed by the python function fnmatch)
- NotSupported build skips fixed

title: Minor update to tools - logging of tests and output
Minor update to tools - logging of tests and output
Tools improvements
body:
This improves the following aspects about building and listing tests:
- Build logs has reduced amount of repeated toolchain errors (most, if not all, should be gone now)
- Printing tests is now done in alphabetical order
- Test names are now always printed in lower case
- Test build filtering is now case insensitive and can accept a comma separated list of blob names (as parsed by the python function `fnmatch`)
- NotSupported build skips fixed

title: Fix armcc ulib template - removal
body:
This removes ulib template, as we use command line options. I checked a project for KL05Z , no changes in the sizes with or without a template.

cc @ohagendorf @bcostm

title: Tools integration rebase
body: Just getting this branch up-to-date

title: Add missing EFM32 Pearl Gecko to README.
[EFM32] Update license texts.
body:
Update EFM32 license texts to proper Apache-2.0 headers with SPDX identifier. This PR contains no functional changes.

@0xc0170

title: Fix inclusion (board.c and critical.c)
body:
One header missing to include in the board.c to get mbed_error_vfprintf(), plus critical.c to get UINT32_MAX constant

@c1728p9

title: [project.py] is broken
body:
After PR #1893 project.py does not work any longer.
The generated zip files are nearly empty or an exception is generated. In the following some examples:

Exporting to gcc:

```
python project.py -m NUCLEO_F401RE -i gcc_arm -p 28
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "project.py", line 213, in <module>
    tmp_path, report = export(project_dir, project_name, ide, mcu, project_dir, project_temp, clean=clean, zip=zip, extra_symbols=lib_symbols, relative=sources_relative)
  File "E:\GitHub\mbed\tools\export\__init__.py", line 105, in export
    exporter.generate()
  File "E:\GitHub\mbed\tools\export\gccarm.py", line 150, in generate
    self.gen_file('gcc_arm_%s.tmpl' % self.target.lower(), ctx, 'Makefile')
  File "E:\GitHub\mbed\tools\export\exporters.py", line 169, in gen_file
    open(target_path, "w").write(target_text)
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'E:\\GitHub\\mbed\\.build\\export\\.temp\\Makefile'
```

Exporting to coide

```
python project.py -m NUCLEO_F401RE -i coide -p 28
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "project.py", line 213, in <module>
    tmp_path, report = export(project_dir, project_name, ide, mcu, project_dir, project_temp, clean=clean, zip=zip, extra_symbols=lib_symbols, relative=sources_relative)
  File "E:\GitHub\mbed\tools\export\__init__.py", line 105, in export
    exporter.generate()
  File "E:\GitHub\mbed\tools\export\coide.py", line 110, in generate
    self.gen_file('coide_%s.coproj.tmpl' % target, ctx, '%s.coproj' % self.program_name)
  File "E:\GitHub\mbed\tools\export\exporters.py", line 169, in gen_file
    open(target_path, "w").write(target_text)
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'E:\\GitHub\\mbed\\.build\\export\\.temp\\MBED_BLINKY.coproj'
```

Exporting to uvision/uvision5:
- no exception but
- generated zip file nearly empty (sizes before PR 1335kB after PR 5kB for NUCLEO_F401RE)

cc @screamerbg @theotherjimmy @sg- @0xc0170

title: [BEETLE] Enable RTOS on Beetle
body:
This patch enables RTOS support on Beetle.
It contains:
- Updated Beetle Startup code for ARMCC
- Modified SysTick Driver
- RTOS specific configuration parameters
- RTOS specific test suite enablement

Signed-off-by: Vincenzo Frascino vincenzo.frascino@arm.com

title: GCC_ARM changes to support uVisor
body: Also other changes to test tools

title: Fix GCC malloc lock
body:
The malloc lock functions were not declared as extern "C" so they
are not getting linked to the standard library.  Add extern "C" to
fix this.

This bug was introduced in the commit:
d0b7b3b497ae1824bb8cb07603c90f5105d7818d -
Fix duplicate symbols for malloc lock and unlock

title: Fix pin mode for STM32F1 target.
Replacement for #1872
body:
Rebased, and fixed IAR exporter and gcc (both expor and build) - tested on top of another fix which is already for review.

@theotherjimmy

title: [STM32F0xx] Fix for #816 issue
body:
This is a fix for #816 issue only for F0xx family. It contains two changes:

Partial revert of 07b841b and currently we are only reverting the
STM32F0xx family because new fix will be presented that's why we want to keep,
still the original solution only F1xx family (it will be fixed in future).

Also a solution for issue #816 when having two separate IRQ handlers
in Timers (UPDATE Irq and OutputCompare Irq). The update priority needs to
be higher to avoid undefined behaviours.
# 

Tested on NUCLEO_F070RB and NUCLEO_F030R8 in multiple cases and MBED_16 is passed OK. Please find the test report below.

**NUCLEO_F070RB** 
All compilers, multiple tested times:
- 1000/1500/1000 - OK
- 500/1000/500 - OK
- 1500/2000/1500 - OK
- 600/800/600 - OK
- sampling rate in Saleae 90s

MBED_16 OK
# 

**NUCLEO_F030R8** 
All compilers, multiple tested times:
- 1000/1500/1000 - OK
- 500/1000/500 - OK
- 1500/2000/1500 - OK
- 600/800/600 - OK
- sampling rate in Saleae 90s

MBED_16 OK

title: Tools/project - project dir should be the list
body:
The project dir if using just project.py shall be a list of directories.

Using `project.py -m KL25Z -t IAR` works with this fix. I'll continue testing this patch, as there are some other problems.

cc @screamerbg

title: Config tests, GCC flags, requirements.txt
body:
This PR adds:
- Config system tests
- GCC flags to support uVisor
- Updated requirements.txt

title: Add virtual destructor to classes
body:
Add a virtual destructor to classes which have a virtual lock and
unlock.  Remove the virtual qualifier from functions in
InterruptManager since this class cannot be extended.

title: Aligned make.py and build.py options
body: CC @0xc0170 @sg-

title: Only allow one thread for unsafe stdlib
[build tools] Added support for cumulative attributes in configs directly
body:
Example in your mbed_lib.json:

``` json
Attributes now get the filtering provided by target_overrides: 
{                                                              
    "name": "cmsis-nodejs-SQL-x86",                            
    "target_overrides": {                                      
        "*": {                                                 
            "device_has": ["SILLY_STRING", "FIRE"]             
        },                                                     
        "SHOE": {                                              
            "features_add": ["SMELLS_FUNNY"],                  
            "features_remove": ["SMELLS_NICE"]           
        }                                                      
    }                                                          
}                                                                          
```

This shares the previous logic in custom_targets but avoids the need to instantiate a target. We may want to look into removing duplicate logic between the config and target systems at a later date.

cc @screamerbg, @bogdanm, @bridadan

title: [rtos] Fixed registers clobbered SVC_Handler in IAR
body:
The rtx SVC_Handler for IAR clobbers r0-r3 despite the number of
arguments. However, in the SVC calls, the __swi function is declared
with fewer arguments. IAR doesn't understand that the other registers are
clobbered and stores variables in r0-r3 when multiple SVCs are
dispatched in a single function.

This bug was noticed in osThreadExit, which hard-faults on IAR,
preventing any threads from exiting.

title: rename section used for eth and usb
[HRM1017] Update exporting template
body: changed merging softdevice from s110 to s130

title: Add alias for uvision4 exporter
body:
it is now called both uvision (old name) and uvision4 (new alias)

for consistency, and explicitness reasons

title: Corrected virtualenv-related instructions in README.md
body: I tried to follow the setup instructions in README.md but discovered that they didn't work because they referred to the non-existent venv/Scripts directory, and didn't properly source the correct file. This PR fixes those instructions.

title: Correct virtualenv instructions in README.md
body: I tried to follow the setup instructions in README.md but discovered that they didn't work because they referred to the non-existent venv/Scripts directory, and didn't properly source the correct file. This PR fixes those instructions.

title: Adjust the main stack of nrf51 targets to the call stack of thesoftdevice.
body:
The call stack of the soft device can be 0x600 (1536) bytes deep. By
adjusting the stack to a value of 2048 bytes, their is enough room for
the softdevice and RTX kernel to live together in the main stack.

Random issues due to stack overflow were visible with the previous value.

**Important** most RTOS tests on NRF51822 target are expected to fail because their is not enough space left for other threads. Tests are fine on NRF51_DK.

title: Fix function RTOS ticker of nrf51 port
body:
The function is_in_wrapped_range, was returning false instead of true when begin <= val < end. 

The documentation was correct but not the code.

title: Added warning about stack alignment limitations on IAR
body:
IAR only allows word size alignment in MBED_ALIGN attribute. Noted in toolchain.h.

cc @mjs-arm

title: [STM32L0] Add USART force/release Reset at Init phase
[STM32F3] Add USART force/release Reset at Init phase
mbed Tools features and improvements
body:
This PR renames the mbed workspace_tools to tools and adds various features:
- response file support to all toolchains
- config system and CLI script
- memory map analysis for every successful build
- build.py and make.py support for different file layouts

title: Fixed uninitialized port in lwip dragged in by KSDK2
body:
It seems that a clock-enable was missed for port B in lwip-eth. This bug does not appear if printfs flush before bringing up the ethernet, making the issue rare.

cc @0xc0170, @bridadan

title: KSDK2 - restore interrupts in InstallIRQHandler
body:
Restore the state of interrupts inside InstallIRQHandler rather than
leaving them enabled.

title: [STM32F0] Add USART force/release Reset at Init phase
body: Continuation of fixing Issue #1705

title: [STM32L4XX] Fix heap size for RTOS on uARM
body: After #1846 the RTOS on uARM was still failing. There were not enough space for scheduler and main thread which take both 1KB of RAM.

title: Feature label
body: This should replace https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/1878

title: the contents of Driver_Storage.h don't need to be guarded by #if DEVI
Don't pull KSDK FSL libraries into apps
body:
Freescale KSDK2 gpio_object.h pulled in Freescale libraries to inline
some GPIO operations.

The resulting namespace pollution (status_t) doesn't seem to be worth
the function call overhead. Hopefully making the base address array
non-automatic will offset that loss.

title: Adding a blank line to commit
body: Because the encoding is wrong, and we can't build the API docs like that. GitHub said a commit will fix the encoding, so I'm comitting.

title: RTOS - add mbed_lib.json file
body:
Defines that rtos is present, this resolves in the macro:
"MBED_CONF_RTOS_PRESENT=1"

By default, this macro would not be defined neither set, thus RTOS disabled, more to come soon.

@c1728p9 @sg-

title: Update function get_interrupts_disabled() to return a bool value rather
body:
than an integer. This removes the need for all users to mask the returned
value with 0x1 to determine interrupt status.
Expose this function externally to allow other users to check interrupt
status in a manner which will work for both cortex-A and cortex-M .
Usage:
bool disabled = get_interrupts_disabled();

title: No support for reent structures in GCC
body:
GCC reent structures are not swapped out on task switches as they should be.  This needs  to be fixed.  Useful link below:
https://developer.mbed.org/users/AdamGreen/notebook/newlib-nano/

title: Rename "features" to "device_has" in targets.json
body:
"features" will make more sense in the context of the feature support
that we'll introduce later (related to #1878). Plus, "device_has" is
arguably a better description of the actual content of this key.

title: Support for Blue Pill
body:
So-called "Blue Pill" is generic development board with STM32F103C8T6 MCU (20KB SRAM, 64KB FLASH), available from Chinese vendors & sellers on ebay, aliexpress or banggood, [see the description](http://www.cnx-software.com/2016/05/17/bluepill-is-a-2-arduino-compatible-development-board-based-on-stmicro-stm32-mcu/). It's cheap and manufacturing quality is "good enough for this price" (usually below $2 incl. shipping on aliexpress).

The support included in this PR is preliminary, basic tests that do not require additional peripherials pass, including venerable blinky. HAL and CMSIS files are copied & modified from NUCLEO-F103RB. Only GCC_ARM support as I don't have any other toolchain on linux.

EDIT: I signed the agreement, I have developer.mbed.org account with the same name as here.
